availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. North Carolina native. Married Martha Ann Thompson. Father of H. C. Thompson, William K. Thompson, Rachel E. Thompson, John Z. Thompson, S. A. Thompson, J. W. Thompson, M. E. Thompson, and J. F. Thompson. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860. Postmaster of Benton, Marshall County, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 435B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, p. 768.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p. 575 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Name (Birth-Death)," Memorial #26037578, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26037578 (accessed September 4, 2019).
